titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 695) to amend the National Child Protection Act of 1993 to establish a national criminal history background check system and criminal history review program for certain individuals who, related to their employment, have access to children, the elderly, or individuals with disabilities, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 695) to amend the National Child Protection Act of 1993 to establish a national criminal history background check system and criminal history review program for certain individuals who, related to their employment, have access to children, the elderly, or individuals with disabilities, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-537, by Ms. Cheney.

Provides for consideration of the Senate amendments to H.R. 695 and makes in order a motion offered by the Chair of the Committee on Appropriations that the House concur in the Senate amendment to the title and concur in the Senate amendment to the text with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-56.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 122.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 714.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 232 - 187 (Roll no. 47).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 236 - 183 (Roll no. 48).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 695) to amend the National Child Protection Act of 1993 to establish a national criminal history background check system and criminal history review program for certain individuals who, related to their employment, have access to children, the elderly, or individuals with disabilities.
